articles.title: Julia Parish
articles.description: Experienced Program Director with a passion for data science, spatial analysis, and conservation.
articles.contents:

Education
Master of Environmental Data Science | Expected June 2022  Bren School of Environmental Science & Management  University of California, Santa Barbara
Bachelor of Arts in Interdisciplinary Studies: Environmental Studies | May 2007  University of Hawaii at Manoa
Master’s Capstone Project
Snow Today, 01/2022 to PresentRole: Communications Manager | Client: UCSB Earth Research Institute  - Developing an interactive Python-based web application to visualize snow cover and albedo data to expand data availability and the geographical extend of remotely sensed snow data.  - Creating data and website navigation Python-based tutorials and writing technical documentation to educate global users on Snow Today snow condition data.
Experience
American Conservation Experience | San Diego, CA - Restoration Specialist | 04/20 to 07/21 - Director | 06/18 to 04/20
Catalina Island Conservancy | Avalon, CA Plant Conservation Manager | 04/15 to 07/18
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI Director | 12/12 to 04/15
Center for Conservation Research and Training at the University of Hawaii | Honolulu, HI and Papahanaumokuakea National Marine Monument CCRT Field Project Support Assistant | 07/10 to 12/12
Center for Environmental Management of Military Lands | Hilo, HI - Botanist (Research Assistant I) | 11/08 to 06/09 - Incipient Weed Control Biologist (Research Assistant II) | 07/09 to 07/10
Oahu Invasive Species Committee | Honolulu, HI - Outreach Specialist | 12/07 to 11/08 - Field Technician (AmeriCorps) | 12/06 - 11/07
Organization for Tropical Studies | La Selva Biological Station, Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui, Costa Rica National Science Foundation and Duke University Research Education for Undergraduates Research Fellow | 06/06 - 08/06
Certifications & Licenses
Cartography - ESRI MOCC, 2022 Adult Mental Health First Aid - Mental Health First Aid USA, 2021 Diversity & Equity Training – Cream City Conservation & Consulting, 2021 California Qualified Applicator License – CA Department of Pesticide Regulation, 2017Brown Treesnake Rapid Response Team - United States Geological Services, 2014
Skills
Programming Languages: R, Python, SQL, Bash, Markdown, familiar with HTML and CSSSoftware: Anaconda Navigator, ESRI (ArcGIS, ArcGIS Pro), R Studio, Git, GitHub, Jupyter Lab, Jupyter Notebook, Binder, Google Earth Engine, Tableau Desktop, Tableau Prep, pgAdmin, QGIS, SQLite, Microsoft Office Suite, Google Workspace, Zoom, Prezzi, WixProject Management: Github Issues, Asana, Basecamp, Podio, Slack, Clockify, Zotero, Zenhub
Publications & Articles
Duffy, D., Parish, J., et al. (2015). Has the Small Indian Mongoose Become Established on Kauai Island, Hawaii? Pacific Science, 69(4), 559-565. https://doi.org/10.2984/69.4.9 
Mazurkiewicz, D., Parish, J., et al. (2017). Restoration and Protection of the Archipelago’s Flora and Habitats: A New Era. Fremontia, 45(3), 26. Parish, J. (2010). Targeting Pohakuloa’s “Most Un-Wanted”: The Incipient Weed Program at PTA. Ecosystems Management Program Bulletin 48, 4-6.
Presentations & Posters
Parish, J. “Implementing an Early Detection Program on Catalina Island: Prioritizing Landscaped Grasses” Poster. Island Invasives Symposium. Dundee, Scotland. 2017. Parish, J. “Prioritizing Miconia calvescens Survey on Oahu” Presentation. California Invasive Plant Council Symposium, San Diego, CA. 2015. 
Saunter, M., Nimz, I., Worcester, N., Vanderlip, C., Parish, J., Marie, A. “Adapting Habitat Management to a Newly Colonized Indigenous Plant on Kure Atoll” Poster. Hawaii Conservation Conference. Honolulu, HI. July 2013.Parish, J. “The Incipient Weed Program at Pohakuloa Training Area, Hilo, HI” Poster. Hawaii Conservation Conference. Honolulu, HI. 2010. Parish, J. and Fincher, R. M. “Bioassay of Secondary Metabolites in Ethnobotanically Important Plant Species: The detection and response of Paraponera clavata to chemical compounds in plants.” Presentation. NSF REU Internship Summer Research Project. La Selva Biological Field Station Puerto Viejo de Sarapiqui, Costa Rica. 2006. 
Professional Affiliations
Board Member, Secretary, President | California Invasive Plant Council 2017 – 2021Member | California Native Plant Society 2016 – PresentMember | Society for Ecological Restoration 2019 – 2021Member | San Diego County Weed Management Area 2018 – 2021Board Member | Friends of the Hawaiian Island National Wildlife Refuges 2017 – 2019Board Member | Southern California Botanical Society 2017 - 2018Member | Los Angeles County Weed Management Area 2015 - 2018

            Biography
            I am currently a candidate for a Master’s in Environmental Data Science at the Bren School of Environmental Science & Management at the University of California, Santa Barbara. Since graduating from the University of Hawaii at Manoa with a B.A. in Environmental Studies, I have led field teams to enhance biological diversity, ecosystem health, and cultural and recreational resources on islands in the Pacific region and throughout Southern California. While working at Pohakuloa Training Area on Hawaii Island, I developed and implemented an invasive plant early detection and rapid response program, which involved establishing data collection and mapping standards. This experience solidified my passion for collecting and maintaining tidy data. I am an experienced Program Director with expertise in project management, spatial analysis, and invasion biology. After obtaining my master’s, I will focus on aiding land managers and conservation organizations with developing management priorities based on data science tools and analysis. When not working, I can be found in the ocean, playing capoeira, or volunteering on a remote atoll surrounded by thousands of seabirds.
            
            
            Education
            Bren School for Environmental Science & Management | Santa Barbara, CA     Master of Environmental Data Science | Expected June 2022
            The University of Hawaii at Manoa | Honolulu, HI     Bachelor of Arts in Environmental Studies | 2007

              Biography

Since graduating from the University of Hawaii at Manoa with a B.A. in Environmental Studies, I have led field teams to enhance biological diversity, ecosystem health, and cultural and recreational resources on islands in the Pacific region and throughout Southern California. While working at Pohakuloa Training Area on Hawaii Island, I developed and implemented an invasive plant early detection and rapid response program, which involved establishing data collection and mapping standards. This experience solidified my passion for collecting and maintaining tidy data. I am an experienced Program Director with expertise in project management, spatial analysis, and invasion biology. After obtaining my master’s, I will focus on aiding land managers and conservation organizations with developing management priorities based on data science tools and analysis. When not working, I can be found in the ocean, playing capoeira, or volunteering on a remote atoll surrounded by thousands of seabirds.
